  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      initialize the form, set up the two table views, and load data from the selected product.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - the path for the form
      resourceBundle - the data to be internationalized

    • onPartSearch

      public void onPartSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      onPartSearch searches through the list of parts in the inventory, looking for either the string partial or part id given in the TextField. When parts are found, a new list with the found parts is generated and displayed in the table view. If no matching parts are found, an error is displayed. If nothing is typed, all parts are displayed.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by activating the partSearch textfield.

    • onAddPart

      public void onAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      onAddPart takes the selected Part in the Parts table and adds it to the list of Parts to be associated with the Product. The associatedPartsTable view is then updated.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the Add Part button

    • onRemovePart

      public void onRemovePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      onRemovePart prompts the user for confirmation, then takes the selected Part in the associatedPartsTable view and removes it from the list of Parts to be associated with the Product. The associatedPartsTable view is then updated.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the Remove Part button

    • onCancel

      public void onCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      onCancel prompts the user for confirmation, then switches to the Main form without saving product data.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the Cancel button.
      Throws:
      IOException - makes sure the i/o operation is not interrupted.

    • onSave

      public void onSave(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      onSave creates variables to hold new product data, and tries to assign them from their respective text fields. Several validation functions are run, and if each field is valid, a new product is created then added to the inventory. The original product is then deleted. If a field is invalid, a prompt displays detailing the error.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - the event triggered by the Save button.

    • validateName

      public boolean validateName(String name)
      validateName returns true if the name is not an empty string.
      Parameters:
      name - the string to be validated.
      Returns:
      true if non-empty, false if empty.

    • validateRange

      public boolean validateRange(int min, int max, int stock)
      validateRange makes sure min is less than max and that stock is between min and max, inclusive. Returns boolean value based on results.
      Parameters:
      min - the min number to be compared.
      max - the max number to be compared.
      stock - the stock number to be compared.
      Returns:
      true if all checks valid, false otherwise.

    • showAlert

      public void showAlert(int alert)
      showAlert uses a switch to display certain error messages to be used by other functions.
      Parameters:
      alert - the alert number to be selected and displayed.
